mdRecord.dcterms:title: Taggart House, exterior
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
Wright, Lloyd (American architect and scenographer, 1890-1978) [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Wright designed and built a number of houses in the Hollywood and Los Feliz districts of Los Angeles in the mid- to late 1920s. His first important house there was for the mother of his second wife Helen Taggart, the Taggart House, a registered Los Angeles Historic-Cultural Monument located next to the city's Griffith Park. He worked with cast concrete using board and batten detailing, and an open plan. Having produced many of the renderings of FLW prairie houses for the Wasmuth Portfolio published in Berlin, Lloyd absorbed the principles of this total design concept. Bookshelves and light fixtures are built in. Hardwood floors and unusual detailing plus a dramatic two story living/dining space are featured. -- http://la.curbed.com/archives/2009/11/lloyd_wrights_taggart_house_in_los_feliz.php [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning
